title: Discovery Learning Design Through Systematic Inquiry: Enhancing Science Concept Understanding

context.prior_knowledge: Basic science theories and comprehension of experimental procedures
context.additional_context: Establishing and applying systematic exploration strategies individually in simulation-based learning environments using digital devices

learning_goals: Learners can systematically manipulate simulation tool parameters to analyze causal relationships in scientific phenomena.
Learners can apply a systematic three-stage inquiry strategy (variable control, pattern observation, hypothesis verification) in experimental design.
Learners can recognize confusion arising during inquiry processes and resolve it through structured problem-solving procedures.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
